channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12944] Support patches to branches in precommit jenkins build
item.description:
We have a quite a few active branches now, which makes backporting a full time job.

I was thinking about whether we can get hadoopqa to test the patches specific to branches with the code from that branch. I think we can grab the branch name from the patch file name and check out that branch prior to running the tests. I have a patch, but not sure whether it will work. Let me experiment a bit. If hadoopqa gets broken, it is probably this issue.
item.summary: Support patches to branches in precommit jenkins build

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Here is the patch, but totally untested. I've only tested the findBranchNameFromPatchName() function.

We can commit this, try to fix it live, and if not successful revert the patch. What do you guys think?

+1

Will be a huge help if we can get it working.

+1

if we don't wipe the workspace on every build, you should do a git clean -xdf while changing branches.

nit: I'd tighten up the regex, but looks like this will work well enough for now.
I think maybe it's not assuming "master" when no branch matches?
As long as you're not bothering any concurrent RMs' work, I think it's fine to experiment live
Ok. I've committed this version of the patch. I'll keep this jira open and try out a couple of builds with hadoopqa.
test patch for branch-1.

Fixed something in the script. reattaching the test patch. 


commit 3931910460405488a16359d9ab24a3b75ff94044

Author: Enis Soztutar <enis@apache.org>

Date:   Thu Jan 29 15:07:58 2015 -0800



    HBASE-12944 Support patches to branches in precommit jenkins build (ADDENDUM to fix the script)

Another small fix: 


commit a5613efa7b22a31811cd326e9ad231911afdbde2

Author: Enis Soztutar <enis@apache.org>

Date:   Thu Jan 29 15:30:05 2015 -0800



    HBASE-12944 Support patches to branches in precommit jenkins build (ADDENDUM moves sourcing of .properties file to start of the script)

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12695398/test-hadoopqa-branch-1.patch
against branch-1 branch at commit a5613efa7b22a31811cd326e9ad231911afdbde2.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12695398

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/12640//console

This message is automatically generated.

For those of you tuning in, I think we may have some success. The ongoing precommit job from: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/12640/console


======================================================================

======================================================================

    Testing patch on branch branch-1.

======================================================================

======================================================================





git checkout branch-1

Previous HEAD position was a5613ef... HBASE-12944 Support patches to branches in precommit jenkins build (ADDENDUM moves sourcing of .properties file to start of the script)

Switched to a new branch 'branch-1'

Branch branch-1 set up to track remote branch branch-1 from origin.

git status

On branch branch-1

Your branch is up-to-date with 'origin/branch-1'.



Untracked files:

  (use "git add <file>..." to include in what will be committed)



	patchprocess/



nothing added to commit but untracked files present (use "git add" to track)

...

I'll monitor the build. It should update here with the results from branch-1 hopefully.

The job failed because the following is not in branch-1. The jenkins env is still not fixed regarding the bash issue, so I'll just backport that commit into all applicable branches (let me do branch-1 first though).

Good news that this seems to be working. Notice that above build was actually from branch-1 code. Let me attach dummy patches for 0.98 and 0.94 as well. I've pushed aa71a8b9b9a0290c3e2bdcb4d2975ac778e28101 to 0.94, 0.98 and branch-1.0 as well. I'll close this issue and send a dev notice if all goes well.
